intro: Psychotria radicans, commonly known as the climbing psychotria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its trailing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green with a glossy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers, which are followed by dark blue to black berries. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other plants with similar morphological features. Psychotria radicans is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
